metadata.title: CVE-2017-14441 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the ICO imagerendering functionality of SDL2_image-2.0.2. A specially crafted ICO imagecan cause an integer overflow, cascading to a heap overflow resulting incode execution. An attacker can display a specially crafted image totrigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14441` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.3+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3+dfsg1-1').
sdl-image1.2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-8').
